title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate GaterTools’ total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $580 and/or does not show the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $10×58 = $580 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aabsfacaqGVbGaaeiDaiaabggacaqGSbGaaeiiaiaabkfacaqGLbGa aeODaiaabwgacaqGUbGaaeyDaiaabwgacaqGGaGaaeypaiaabccaca qGqbGaaeOCaiaabMgacaqGJbGaaeyzaiabgEna0kaabgfacaqG1bGa aeyyaiaab6gacaqG0bGaaeyAaiaabshacaqG5bGaaeiiaiaab2daca qGGaGaaeijaiaabgdacaqGWaGaey41aqRaaeynaiaabIdacaqGGaGa aeypaiaabccacaqGKaGaaeynaiaabIdacaqGWaaaaa@6149@

The response calculates GaterTools’ total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $580 and shows the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $10×58 = $580 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aabsfacaqGVbGaaeiDaiaabggacaqGSbGaaeiiaiaabkfacaqGLbGa aeODaiaabwgacaqGUbGaaeyDaiaabwgacaqGGaGaaeypaiaabccaca qGqbGaaeOCaiaabMgacaqGJbGaaeyzaiabgEna0kaabgfacaqG1bGa aeyyaiaab6gacaqG0bGaaeyAaiaabshacaqG5bGaaeiiaiaab2daca qGGaGaaeijaiaabgdacaqGWaGaey41aqRaaeynaiaabIdacaqGGaGa aeypaiaabccacaqGKaGaaeynaiaabIdacaqGWaaaaa@6149@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the quantity demanded will decrease by more than 4% and/or does not explain that the demand is elastic in this price range because marginal revenue is positive.
The response states that the quantity demanded will decrease by more than 4% and explains that the demand is elastic in this price range because marginal revenue is positive.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at a quantity of 10 units GaterTools’ marginal product is increasing and/or does not explain that the marginal cost is falling.
The response states that at a quantity of 10 units GaterTools’ marginal product is increasing and explains that the marginal cost is falling.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity as 45 units and/or does not explain that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.
The response identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity as 45 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm earns negative economic profit and/or does not explain that the firm’s average total cost curve is above the demand curve, or the firm charges a price that is less than the average total cost, or P < ATC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGqbGaaeiiai aabYdacaqGGaGaaeyqaiaabsfacaqGdbaaaa@3E37@ .

The response states that the firm earns a positive economic profit and explains that the firm’s average total cost curve is above the demand curve, or the firm charges a price that is less than the average total cost, or P < ATC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGqbGaaeiiai aabYdacaqGGaGaaeyqaiaabsfacaqGdbaaaa@3E37@ .

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not state that yes, GaterTools has a dominant strategy to lower the price and/or does not explain that GaterTools’ payoff is always higher when it lowers its price ( $420 > $200 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabkdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaab6dacaqGGaGaaeijaiaabkdacaqGWaGa aeimaaaa@408D@ and $520 > $300 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeynai aabkdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaab6dacaqGGaGaaeijaiaabodacaqGWaGa aeimaaaa@408F@ ) regardless of whether HandyBilt chooses to advertise or not.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the Nash equilibrium as GaterTools lowers its price and HandyBilt does not advertise with payoffs of ($520 , $440) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabwdacaqGYaGaaeimaiaabccacaqGSaGaaeiiaiaabscacaqG0aGa aeinaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@41D9@ , and/or does not explain that if GaterTools chooses to maintain its price its payoff will decrease from $520 to $300 and if HandyBilt chooses to advertise its payoff will decrease from $440 to $400; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response identifies the Nash equilibrium as GaterTools lowers its price and HandyBilt does not advertise with payoffs of ($520 , $440) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabwdacaqGYaGaaeimaiaabccacaqGSaGaaeiiaiaabscacaqG0aGa aeinaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@41D9@ , and explains that if GaterTools chooses to maintain its price its payoff will decrease from $520 to $300 and if HandyBilt chooses to advertise its payoff will decrease from $440 to $400; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.
